data.description: Job SummaryThe Data/Analytics Intern will support the maintenance, enhancement, and ongoing support of tkMNA regional systems and applications within the Data & Analytics function. This role works closely with cross-functional team members to assist in developing dashboards, analytics solutions, and automation initiatives. By the end of the internship, the intern will gain exposure to multiple IT applications and hands-on experience with data visualization and Power Platform tools.Job DescriptionKey Accountabilities:Learn and understand the functionality of various IT applications and systemsCollaborate with business stakeholders to identify and define Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)Understand databases, table schemas, and data relationshipsInterpret data, perform data analysis, and conduct data validationDevelop high-quality Power BI dashboards and visualizationsDesign and build Power Apps (Canvas and Model-driven) to streamline workflows and improve data captureCreate and configure Power Platform agents using Power Automate and Copilot Studio to automate processes and enhance user experienceWork with Cloud and DevOps teams on API development, integration, and performance optimizationParticipate in meetings and shadow team members to capture detailed system and process knowledgeDocument findings and update the knowledge repository with information gathered during shadowing sessionsFollow established department documentation standards and templatesPerform testing, enhancements, and quality checks to ensure solution accuracy and usabilityParticipate in peer-to-peer training sessions and solution reviewsSupport user documentation, training, and adoption of analytics and automation solutionsQualifications:Currently enrolled full-time in an accredited university. Junior or Senior academic standingBusiness Management, Information Systems, Computer Science or any degree in the related fields. 3.0 or higher GPAAbility to think critically and keep up in a fast-paced environment is criticalThe ideal candidate will have a passion for business and technologyInterest to learn data and create appealing Visualizations. Understanding of MS Power Platform.Strong communication, research and organizational skillsProficient in Microsoft O365 suite; Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, Teams and Excel  Self-motivated, competitive, assertiveAbility to work both independently and in a team settingWillingness to take feedback and iterate on dashboards.Ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines.Willingness to learn new tools, technologies, and processesThe above is intended to describe the general content of and requirement for the performance of this job.  It is not to be construed as an exhaustive statement of duties, responsibilities or requirements.Benefits OverviewWe offer competitive company benefits to eligible positions, such as :Medical, Dental, Vision InsuranceLife Insurance and DisabilityVoluntary Wellness Programs401(k) and RRSP programs with Company Match Paid Vacation and HolidaysTuition ReimbursementAnd more!Benefits may vary based on job, country, union role, and/or company segment.
